Package com.shikhardev.mancala.services

Class BoardService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.shikhardev.mancala.services.BoardService
  • @Service
public class BoardService
extends java.lang.Object
    Class represents services associated with the board, including initiation, move implementation on the board with stone dynamics handled.

    • Method Detail

      • getPitByID

        public Pit getPitByID​(int id)
               throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Gets pit if id is valid and board initiated.
        Parameters:
        id - [0, 13]
        Returns:
        Pit object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException

      • initPit

        public Pit initPit​(int pitID)
        Creates a pit object for the specified pitID. Figures out the right - pit owner {Player object representing player 1 / 2} - pit type {PitType.PLAYGROUND / PitType.HOME} - initial stone count {0, 6} based on the pit id.
        Parameters:
        pitID - [0, 14]
        Returns:
        Pit object with the right settings.

      • initBoard

        public void initBoard()
        Initializes the class' board object with all 14 pits

      • arePitsInRangeEmpty

        public boolean arePitsInRangeEmpty​(int fromID,
                                   int toID)
        Returns true if all pits in the specified range have 0 stones. Else, returns false.

      • doesPlayerContinue

        public boolean doesPlayerContinue()
        This method is typically called after execution of a move. Returns true if the same player should make the next move also. Else, returns false.

      • getPlayerHomeCount

        public int getPlayerHomeCount​(Player player)
        Returns the number of stones at the Home pit of the specified player
        Parameters:
        player - : Player object whose home-pit count is requested

      • collectRemainingStones

        public void collectRemainingStones()
        If the game has ended, at least one side of the board is empty. If there are remaining stones on one of the sides, it will be allocated to player of that side.

      • collectRemainingStones

        private void collectRemainingStones​(int lower,
                                    int upper)
        Only called from the collectRemainingStones() function. Increments the home stone count by the total number of remaining stones in the board.
        Parameters:
        lower - : Starting pit ID of the current side
        upper - : Home ID of the current side

      • captureOppositeStones

        public void captureOppositeStones​(Player mover,
                                  Pit latestPit)
        While moving, if the move ends on a pit with 0 stones, the current player captures the stones of the opposite side. Home stone count increases by oppositeStoneCount + 1 (player's latest stone).
        Parameters:
        mover - : Player object of the current move-maker
        latestPit - : Pit object at which the current move ended

      • updateBoardForMove

        public void updateBoardForMove​(Move move)
        Executes the specified Move object. Assumes move has already been validated. Calls the captureOppositeStones as well as updates the playerContinues variable to denote if the next move is to be made by a different player.
        Parameters:
        move - : Move object
